documenttitle.text: Red Hat Security Advisory: kernel security and bug fix update

note.text:
An update for kernel is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.5 Extended Update Support.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
The kernel packages contain the Linux kernel, the core of any Linux operating system.

Security Fix(es):

* kernel: heap overflow in mwifiex_update_vs_ie() function of Marvell WiFi driver (CVE-2019-14816)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Bug Fix(es):

* Slow console output with ast (Aspeed) graphics driver (BZ#1780145)

* core: backports from upstream (BZ#1794373)

* System Crash on vport creation (NPIV on FCoE) (BZ#1796362)

* [GSS] Can't access the mount point due to possible blocking of i/o on rbd (BZ#1796432)
note.title: Details

note.text: kernel: heap overflow in mwifiex_update_vs_ie() function of Marvell WiFi driver
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#1744149: CVE-2019-14816 kernel: heap overflow in mwifiex_update_vs_ie() function of Marvell WiFi driver

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Huangwen (ADLab of Venustech) for reporting this issue.
